intro: Scaevola pauciflora, commonly known as the common scaevola, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is a low-growing, mat-forming shrub that thrives in coastal and sandy soils. The plant produces small, showy flowers in clusters, typically in shades of pink, purple, and white. Its leaves are narrow and gray-green, often covered in fine hairs. Scaevola pauciflora is well adapted to arid conditions and is often used in coastal landscaping due to its hardiness and ornamental value.
